Term.Name: INTENTION
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Proprietary
Term.Definition: For use where proprietary extensions are required, or the use of keywords that do not fit in any classification below
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: INFORM
Term.Definition: Programme intended primarily to inform about current facts, situations, events, theories or forecasts, or to provide explanatory background information and advice. Information programme content has to be non-durable, that is to say that one could not imagine that the same programme would be transmitted e.g. one year later without losing most of its relevance. Examples: news, documentaries about current subjects, consumer information
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Government
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Pure information
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Infotainment
Term.Definition: Programmes intended primarily to inform but with entertaining elements.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Advice
Term.Definition: Programme intended to advise about matters of personal interest such as consumer prices and quality, financial matters, health, or, for the interest of special groups, weather or traffic information
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: ENRICH
Term.Definition: Programme primarily intended to increase knowledge about non-current subjects in a didactic or non-didactic way, or to religiously inspire. Enrichment programme content has to be durable, that is to say, one could very well imagine that the programme would be broadcast one year later, without loosing its relevance. Examples: travelogues, war documentaries, educational programmes, religious programmes .
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Education
Term.Definition: Programme primarily intended to increase knowledge about non current subjects in a non-didactic way.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: General enrichment
Term.Definition: Programme primarily intended to increase knowledge about non current subjects in a non-didactic way.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Inspirational enrichment
Term.Definition: Programme based on different forms of religious beliefs or intended to edify the audience.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: ENTERTAIN
Term.Definition: Programme intended primarily to evoke relaxation, feelings of pleasure and/or awareness of beauty.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Pure entertainment
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Informative entertainment
Term.Definition: Programmes intended primarily to entertain but with informative elements.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: PROMOTE
Term.Definition: Intended to promote content. Produced by the broadcaster or media owner. eg trails for TV/Radio
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: ADVERTISE
Term.Definition: Intended to inform consumers about commercial products and services. Produced by/on behalf the owners/sellers of the product or service eg Interstitial commercials
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Infomercial
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Billboarding
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Other / Mixed / Unknown
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Other private
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: FORMAT
Term.Definition: For use where proprietary extensions are required, or the use of keywords that do not fit in any classification below
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Proprietary
Term.Definition: For use where proprietary extensions are required, or the use of keywords that do not fit in any classification below
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: STRUCTURED / NON-FICTION
Term.Definition: All programmes dealing with facts, situations, opinions, theories and forecasts
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Bulletin
Term.Definition: Programme with formal desk presentation, usually interspersed with visual material.Example: news bulletin, weather forecast
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Magazine
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of separate items which has at least one common quality and presented under one main heading
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Commented event
Term.Definition: An outside event covered by the broadcaster and with an accompanying commentary, and transmitted live or deferred (within 2. hours).
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Religious worship service
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Documentary
Term.Definition: Programme concerning a single theme, involving descriptive and/or interpretative commentaries, illustrations, I/vs, statements, photos etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Discussion/Interview/Debate/Talkshow
Term.Definition: Mainly verbal programme in which more than one person participates
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Lecture/Speech/Presentation
Term.Definition: Mainly verbal programme in which only one person participates
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Textual (incl. relayed teletext)
Term.Definition: Programme consisting only of alphanumerical information
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Docusoap
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reality
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Phone-in
Term.Definition: Programme with content primarily generated by contributions from the general audience either on the telephone or by sending in emails/letters
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DJ with discs
Term.Definition: Programme (usually in audio only) in which a specialist presenter introduces music or other pre-recorded elements
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Other / Mixed / Unknown
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Other Private
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: SHOW / ENTERTAINMENT
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Simple game show
Term.Definition: Programme in which the content is primarily contained within the studio and the prizes or rewards (if any) to the participant(s) may be regarded as conservative. Example: University Challenge
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Big game show
Term.Definition: Programme produced on a grand scale in which the prizes or rewards are considered generous Example: Who wants to be a millionaire
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Standup comedian(s)
Term.Definition: Programme performed by a single, a pair or a group of comedians performing directly towards the audience
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reality Show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Real-life soap
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Hosted show
Term.Definition: Programme, that can be regarded neither as non-fiction nor as drama or music/dance in which one or more persons fulfil the role of presenter, host, quiz or games master, announcer, chairperson or speaker and where the rest of the participants are generally members of the public
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Panel-show
Term.Definition: A programme of a light entertainment nature which is presented by a more or less fixed group of people (panel). Programme, that can be regarded neither as non-fiction nor as drama or concert. Example: The Paul Daniels Show; Der Rudi Carrell Show
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: REPRESENTATION/PLAY/FICTION
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of a prose or verse composition, one telling a story, written for or as if for performance by actors.Examples: soap opera, Shakespeare play, Monthy Python, radio play, Not: documentary or informational programme whose subject is drama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Fictional portrayal of life / Performance Drama
Term.Definition: Programme performed by live actors e.g. Performed drama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Readings
Term.Definition: Programmes consisting of readings of poems, stories or other literary works
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cartoon/Animation/Puppetry
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ARTISTIC PERFORMANCE
Term.Definition: Music, Dance, Mime etc. TV programmes (predominantly) consisting of music, dance or ballet or theatrical performance
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Solo performance
Term.Definition: individual performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word eg Nigel Kennedy solo violin performance
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Small ensemble performance
Term.Definition: Performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word by a small number of people Quartet, small ensemble staged play
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Large ensemble performance
Term.Definition: Performance of music, dance, mime or spoken word by a large number of people Orchestra and choirs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Mixed
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: INTERACTIVE
Term.Definition: Formats making use of a range of features such as local application support, return path and direct viewer interaction
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: LOCAL INTERACTIVITY
Term.Definition: Formats that happen in the "box" where broadcast "data" is processed locally giving a sense of dynamic choice
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: INTERMITTENT RESPONSE
Term.Definition: Formats that require an intermittent or continuous return path
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: ALWAYS ON CONNECTION
Term.Definition: Formats that ideally require a continuous connection to be delivered
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Others / Mixed / Unknown
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Other Private
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: CONTENT
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: FICTION/DRAMA
Term.Definition: Programme consisting of a prose or verse composition, resp. one telling a story, written for or as if for performance by actors, puppets or animated
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: General light / Popular drama
Term.Definition: Drama written after approximately 1918 and without literary or cultural pretensions. Popular drama, e.g. Upstairs, Downstairs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Soap
Term.Definition: Dramatized serial programme dealing with easy-to-grasp situations performed by a limited cast
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Romance / Melodrama
Term.Definition: e.g. Romeo and Juliet
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Action
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Fantasy / Fairy tale
Term.Definition: EG Alice in Wonderland
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Adult drama /Erotica
Term.Definition: E.g. Emannuelle
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Other drama
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Drama based on real events (docudrama)
Term.Definition: Drama based upon reality sometimes with documentary inserts
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Classical drama
Term.Definition: Drama written before approximately 1918 e.g. Hamlet, Othello
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Religious
Term.Definition: e.g. The Red Robe,
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Poems / Stories / Readings / Story telling

Term.Name: AMUSEMENT/ENTERTAINMENT
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Quiz / Contest
Term.Definition: Competitions calling into play the competitors' special knowledge and intelligence
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Quiz
Term.Definition: Who Wants to be a millionaire - questions and answers form the entertainment
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Contest
Term.Definition: Participants compete directly with each other eg Americas Top Model, Generation Game
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Dating
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reality
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Variety/Talent
Term.Definition: Programme with various performers such as comedians, magicians, singers etc. e.g. Paul Daniels Show, Relay from a circus
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cabaret
Term.Definition: Specific instance of Variety in an intimate environment
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Talent
Term.Definition: Spelling Bees, singing talent shows - Stars in their eyes, American Idol
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Chat
Term.Definition: Chat Show in which a presenter interviews a celebrity
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Comedy
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Broken comedy
Term.Definition: Humorous and/or satirical programme consisting of short dramatical sequences, sketches, performed by comedians e,g, Benny Hill, Monty Python
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Satire
Term.Definition: Letterman, Dave Allen, etc.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Humour
Term.Definition: Programme without sketches or broken drama consisting (mainly) of verbal jokes, gags, bloopers etc.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Surprise
Term.Definition: Programme of 'dream comes true' type e.g. Jim'llFix It
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Magic/Hypnotism
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Others
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Definition: Music including chamber, instrumental, operatic, symphonic, vocal and choral music

Term.Definition: Music written before the middle of the 17th Century

Term.Name: Jazz
Term.Definition: Indigenous American popular music, born in New Orleans of African slaves social circumstances. The jazz idiom is characterized by certain syncopations over strongly reiterated rhythms in which improvisation plays an important part

Term.Name: INTENDED AUDIENCE
Term.Definition: Programmes not intended for a specific target group.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Proprietary
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: GENERAL AUDIENCE
Term.Definition: Programmes not intended for a specific target group.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: AGE GROUPS
Term.Definition: The age group levels for which the programme is primarily intended..
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Children
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Adults
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: SOCIAL/REGIONAL/MINORITY GROUPS
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Ethnic
Term.Definition: Programme for people differing in language and/or culture E.g. .Local key words to apply (ie Asian, )
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Immigrant groups
Term.Definition: Programme for non-native born people and their immediate descendants, differing in language and/or culture.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Indigineous
Term.Definition: Programme for native born people and their immediate descendants, differing in language and/or culture.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Religious
Term.Definition: Local key words to apply (ie Shinto, Christian, Hindu etc)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Linguistic
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: OCCUPATIONAL GROUPS
Term.Definition: The occupation of the consumer for whitch the programme is primarely intended
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: A
Term.Definition: Opinion former, Judge, Member of the govt etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: B
Term.Definition: Industry leader, Senior Govt figure, Professionals (Doctors, Lawyers etc) etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: C1
Term.Definition: "White Collar worker"
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: C2
Term.Definition: Skilled manual labourer
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: D
Term.Definition: General manual labourer
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: E
Term.Definition: Unemployed (+ students!)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: OTHER SPECIAL INTEREST/OCCUPATIONAL GROUPS
Term.Definition: Local Keywords to apply. (ie Farmer, Student, DIY, Angler, Gay and lesbian,Retired, main shoppers,tourists etc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Main shopper
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Housewife / Housekeeper
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: People with disabilities
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Primarily for males
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Primarily for females
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: GEOGRAPHICAL
Term.Definition: The territory for which the programme is primarily intended..
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Universal
Term.Definition: Intended for all audiences regardless of territory
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Continental
Term.Definition: Asia, European
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: National
Term.Definition: France, S Africa
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Regional
Term.Definition: Mid West, Pacific Rim
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Local
Term.Definition: Zip Codes, Postcodes, Towns, specific local group
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Multinational
Term.Definition: more than one country but not continental
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: International
Term.Definition: more than one country but not continental
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Primary

Term.Name: Tertiary
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Post Graduate/Life Long Learning
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: LIFESTYLE STAGES
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Single
Term.Definition: Single person with no dependants
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Couple
Term.Definition: cohabiting adult with no dependants
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Family with Children 0-3
Term.Definition: adult with pre school children
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Family with Children 4-7
Term.Definition: adult with young children
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Family with Children 8-15
Term.Definition: adult with older children
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Family with Children 16+
Term.Definition: adult with young dependant adults
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML.

Term.Name: Empty Nester
Term.Definition: adult whose dependants have left home
